info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 8:15AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVIER SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT BEAVER...SOUTHEASTERN LAWRENCE...NORTH CENTRAL INDIANA...BUTLER...NORTHERN ALLEGHENY... SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHERN CLARION COUNTIES... At 813 AM EDT, an area of heavier snow showers was located near Gibsonia, or 9 miles northeast of McCandless Township, moving east northeast at 30 mph. Locations impacted include... McCandless Township, Cranberry, Butler, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Kittanning, Rimersburg, Hampton Township, Harrison Township, and Economy. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 11 and 40. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 71 and 96. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 48. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than one mile and a quick half inch to one inch of accumulation in this area of heavier snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
